intro: Pavetta johnstonii subsp. breviloba, commonly known as the narrow-lobed pavetta, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with rounded tips and dense clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
